description: A store and its director are fined after inspectors find rat droppings throughout the premises.
title: Wolverhampton shop fined £11k for trading amid rat infestation
title_page: Wolverhampton shop fined £11k for trading amid rat infestation - BBC News
maintext:
A food shop owner has been fined more than £11k after continuing to trade amid an "active rat infestation" environmental health officers found rat droppings throughout the store.
Sweet Elohim Afro Market in Wolverhampton was prosecuted for two food hygiene breaches which took place in November 2023 and saw it temporarily closed down.
The City of Wolverhampton Council said environmental health officers spotted rat droppings throughout the store.
Director Georgina Konadu also pleaded guilty to the same offences at Dudley Magistrates Court on 12 February.
